Reviews.Title: “Clean great location excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: shahmia
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights during february 2012 and was very impressed with this hotel. It is very close to the airport (one bus takes u close by) as well as being close to the city centre (again one bus journey away) and all important one bus ride away from bernabeu stadium. The room itself was very clean, cleaned daily and as mentioned above in a very good location. There is a chinese restaurant near enough on site as well a couple other restaurants within close walking distance. There is also a small supermarket closeby. For muslim travellers there is a mosque close by (allegedly the largest in europe) that also houses a halal restaurant. I would definately stay at this hotel again, madrid has a good bus network and can get you pretty much everywhere. The room was reasonably priced and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ola Mardid”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Travelodge Torreluguna this morning and absolutely loved it. The hotel was excellent value for money, in a nice area with bars, restaurants and a supermarket. We were a group of three women and we felt really safe and even went out at midnight on the day we arrived. The rooms were basic, but had everything you needed. Tea and coffee making facilities and ironing board available on request. Staff were really friendly and helpful. 15 mins to city centre which isn't bad and the bus is right outside the hotel and ran every 5 minutes and were really clean, so didn't need to use metro, also it was a nice way to see the city. Enjoyed it so much that I will be going back again.Thank you Travelodge!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget room, no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: Booked as part of a package. Arrived late at night so took a Taxi from the airport, about 20 EUR. Pleasant and helpful staff. Rooms are spacious but sparse. Hanging rail with wooden hangers but no wardrobe door or drawers. Small desk, TV with local channels. One chair. Spacious bathroom with full-sized bath, shower over, bidet etc. Plenty of water pressure and hot water. Rooms cleaned and new towels daily. I had a double bed, which was a bit hard, plain white sheets and cover. if you wanted to do some work there is no convenient light near the desk and only one socket (for the TV). Reception doubles as breakfast room, again sparse with basic tables and chairs. Breakfast consists of a choice of 3 cereals, coffee, tea, Orange, toast-it-yourself bread, nice to see brown as well as white. Selection of yoghurt, cold meats/cheese, average cold pastries. In a heated server were scrambled egg, hot-dog sausages and fatty bacon. There is also a 24/7 bar with a draft lager, bottles of Heineken and some spirits. More of a serving hatch than a bar, there is no bar atmosphere. 30 minutes of wi-fi per day, in reception, free on request. Wi-fi in the rooms seemed a bit pricey at 5EUR per hour. The nearest Metro is Barrio de la Concepceon 0.5 miles away but there are 2 changes required to get to Sol Square in the centre of Madrid. Bus 53 stops right outside the hotel and terminates at Sol so you don't need to know where to get off. Always a problem with buses I find. Fares are 1.5 Euro. I took the Metro back to the airport (2 changes required). There is a 3 EUR supplement for trips to/from the airport, payable at the ticket machine or at the airport end. Ticket machines operate in English. Enter ticket into the barrier, gates open, remember to collect your ticket before walking off, you need it to leave the system. Taxis also charge extra for airport trips, or any station. Official Taxis have a red stripe and shield on the door, they can be hailed in the street. I think if I go again, I'll try to find something more central, but that may not be possible at this budget in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elj090846
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this hotel in Madrid & they had slightly improved Wifi situation by giving 30 mins free per day & pronise that it will be free soon! Rooms clean & beds good but the novelty of making the bus journey 4 times a day does wear off & we have promised ourselves a more cental hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Goed maar er is vast iets beters te vinden”
Reviews.Author: Da Z
Reviews.Content: The location is not so good. Its is 7 min walking to the metro. With the metro the rest of the city is easily accessible. Rooms are clean. Wifi is only free for 30 min per day.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: TinLizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this travelodge on business however I like to combine business with a bit of pleasure where possible. It is a travelodge so in terms of 'luxury' there is nothing to speak of and that is the deal, fair enough BUT I pre-booked on line at one price via credit card, when I arrived I was told that I had not paid and then was charged a higher price on my debit card! As previous reviewers have stated, the beds are incredibly firm, again it depends on what you prefer as to whether or not this would be an issue. Be aware that 6 Euros per night is only the price of Breakfast if you have pre-booked and paid, if you suddenly choose the take a breakfast in as I did, it cost 7.50 euros and you are eating in the hotel lobby. The only free access to wi-fi is in the hotel lobby for around 30 minutes and I found it took around 10 minuites just to get connected ! Neither could I enjoy a glass of wine in the evening without going out and about. From the airport it is only 2 stops on the bus so even if you cannot get the driver to understand you, come out of the airport doors, turn right, walk along to the first bus stop and get on the number 200. As others have said there are several little cafes, restaurants nearby, email me if you want more info.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: DeathByStereo
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a little further out of the centre, the bus stop right outside can take you there directly for 1.50 euro. Would definitely recommend the bus into the centre as opposed to the metro, as we found it hard to locate. The hotel itself is very similar to British Travelodges so you know what kind of thing to expect. However we spent very little time in the hotel itself because we were so keen to see Madrid! We stayed for 3 nights for 50 euro for two of us, definitely worth a look in the Travelodge sales!

Reviews.Title: “The only important thing about a hotel is the bed & WWW”
Reviews.Author: noogs1
Reviews.Content: Seriously, if you are traveling for pleasure the hotel is not that important except for you sleeping there and having internet. This place sucks at both. The beds are horribly uncomfortable. And you get wifi in the common area only and pay for it elsewhere. Wise up. Tack wifi into the room charge like every other hotel in Europe and the States. Cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain”
Reviews.Author: Noeggs
Reviews.Content: Just as you would expect a travel lodge in the UK, clean and rooms just the same. Shower pressure amazing. About 10-12 minutes to the metro, didn't try the bus as the metro was so easy to use. American style bar (VIPS) nearby that does an amazing veal burger and good breakfasts. Would definately use again as would rather spend my holiday money on doing things rather than on posh hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location and definitely WORTH it!”
Reviews.Author: babygLondon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 3day stay with Travelodge and couldn't be more happy! From the airport, take number 200 bus at the end of the terminal all the way to the last stop (Avenue de Amricas) Then cross the road to the bus stop opposite and take the number 122 bus. You cannot miss the hotel as the bus stop is outside the hotel. Check in was quick and staff were friendly. We got to the hotel an hour before check in time and they were happy to check us in without charge. Room was a family room, big enough for three of us. The room was clean, clean sheets, clean towels everyday and the shower was excellent. The only problem was the TV, was quite old, but wasn't really bothered as we were out all day and there was no english channel. You need to ask for kettle to make tea in the morning but they don't provide english tea so bring your own PG tips or Tetley. We asked for milk every morning and happy enough to provide it. We didn't take the breakfast. There is a restaurant/supermarket chain called VIPS. English brakfast is for 5/6 euros with drink included. Lunch and dinner were also excellent and value is good too. There is also an Italian place called Mamma Mia and food was good and reasonable. We didn't manage to try the buffet chinese place called Chin Chin next to the hotel. There is also a supermarket across the road but they were renovating the place whilst we were there. There is also another chinese place, tobacco shop and also a little bar. Getting to town couldn't be easier. Bus stop is literally on the hotel doorstep. Take the number 53 to Sol. Take about 20-25 minutes. Lovely to see the residential area of Madrid. Buses ran till 11.30 and very frequent. Area is very safe. Very quiet at night. Overall, we would stay here again and definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location fine for seeing the sites”
Reviews.Author: carlflanders
Reviews.Content: Price for the larger room (we have four in our family) was very reasonable and had all the basics. Breakfast was reasonably priced and convenient. The only problem I had with the breakfast were the mini sausages, pretty sure they made me feel sick for the day. Thank goodness I had only eaten one as I am sometimes wary of meat on a buffet in a smaller place like that. The bus stop was literally right outside and it got you into the heart of the city. Metro was about a 10-15 minute walk depending who you are or coming/going (was at a lower elevation than the Travelodge). Metro easier to navigate if you are not fluent enough to converse with bus drivers. Room always had hot water, great pressure. Couch was a bit old. We stayed 5 nights and we had a loud neighbor one night who shut up after we had reception call them. Stay here if you like paying 4o euros (maximum, often less) a night for a safe hotel and do not mind commuting to tourist spots 30-45 minutes away. There is nothing to see or do right around the hotel but getting to the action is not challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Torrelaguna Madrid a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: JamesP1942
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bargain. It is clean, has the basic amenities, and staff were very helpful. The hot breakfast was fairly complete but not luxurious, but hey, this hotel is not luxurious. It is well located and fairly close to the airport. No shuttle, bus comes right by the front door. A metro stop is a hilly 8 minute walk away. We stayed with grandchildren ages 6 and 11 over New Year's Eve and Day, when restaurants and basically all stores in Madrid were closed. TIP: What saved us with food were two little places not even noted on Google Maps: Both are located on the North side of East-West street on which the hotel is located, the Calle de Condessa del Vendaito, about a half block East of the hotel on the North side of that street. They are clearly visible in the Google Street level photo maps. VIPS - A restaurant that serves a tasty bit of everything including American fare. It has no special Spanish food or delacacies, but it had the great advantage of being OPEN at just about all hours. It is not fast food, but perhaps equivalent to Shoney's in the U.S. OpenCor - This is a small but rather well-stocked grocery store with gift items, magazines, toys, meat, deli, and actually a bigger quick mart. They have enough food for a picnic lunch in your room or out in the park. And they are OPEN at all hours, a lifesaver with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: amyduffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend between 16-19 December 2011, and paid €39 for three nights (booked during the Travelodge sale). Above all, the room was very clean. It could have done with a few more comforts like extra towels and a bath mat, but what do you expect for the price? The staff were efficient and friendly, and were on call 24/7. We didn't try the food so can't comment on that. We found the best way to visit the centre of Madrid was via the Metro, which is excellent. The nearest station is a 10 minute walk away, and the journey takes about 20 minutes. I would recommend buying 10 journeys when you get to the airport as we found this was the cheapest way to travel around (about €10). It's really easy to navigate your way around the city using the Metro, but a little bit of Español helps. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: SteRobbo84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel and it was perfect for us. At 83 Euros for three nights it was great value. With a bus stop right outside it was easy to get to from the airport and easy to get to the city centre plus you get to see the area outside the centre. Most of all the bed was comfy and it was clean!! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: MontyAltea
Reviews.Content: We only paid €29.00 for one night in October and it was a nice modern clean hotel. It had a happy holiday feel about it. Parking was a bit hard to find on the streets but not impossible. A short walk away we found the Metro and some bars. We would stay here again. We were looking forward to having the breakfast but it was €6.00 each and we know that for this type of hotel we should only pay a maximum of €4.00. Better value at one of the local bars. Nothing to do here around the hotel but good for a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: noddy504
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked this trip to Madrid for Mine and my husbands birthday. Before departing I can say I really didn't want to go as I felt that the Travelodge was to far out of the centre of Madrid. However, I must say that I did go and really enjoyed my time there. We arrived at the airport and it cost us 30 euros for the taxi (which I thought was a bit steep). The hotel staff was very friendly and the room was large. I paid 6 euros for each of us to have breakfast but wish I hadn't as the scrambled eggs looked as if it had come from a yellow car tyre, so only had continental breakfast. If you go accross the road along by the shop there is a lovely cafe which does and english type breakfast we I now wish we had. The travelodge really should change all there mattress. there are no mattress covers so you can feel the springs but what do you expect for 35 euros a night. Great bus service from outside of the hotel (no: 53) which goes directly into the centre. On our returt journey to the airport we caught the bus which is only a short walk from the hotel and only 2 stops until you reach the airport so rather than 30 euros it only cost 3. Also I thought that 13 euros for a 3 day pass is excellent. From someone who did not want to do I can't wait to go again as there is a lot still to do.

Reviews.Title: “A decent travelodge at last..”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Found it easy to get to on metro to barrio de conception station with about an extra 5 minutes walk. Even though bus was right outside on many times we walked to gran via in about an hour which is a pleasant walk with plenty on the way. If your unfit take the bus. Rooms were very clean and better than the UK versions which are terrible. Price we paid was cheap cheap cheap for madrid. Supermarket across the road sells everything you need if you want to just sit in after sight seeing. Would definately use again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: 2011MaYa
Reviews.Content: It's a travelodge so don't expect anything mind blowing. Considering the price I paid, it's good value. Relatively clean and easy to get into the central areas of Madrid (Bus 53 is right outside the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...”
Reviews.Author: Johnny60775
Reviews.Content: Family and I spent 7 days at the Travelodge Torrelaguna. Good place to stay outside of downtown Madrid. PROS: (1) Very helpful staff...I noticed in reviews of other hotels that staff can be a bit arrogant...not here; (2) Rooms were clean, generally had an IKEA decor; (3) the shower water pressure was fantastic, better than at home; (4) easy to get to from the Barajas Airport...take the 200 bus from the airport to its final destination (Ave de America), then board the 122 bus and get off right across the street from the hotel...very easy; (5) the metro (Barrio de la Concepcion) was a little less than a half mile away...very easy walk. The metro system is similar to Washington DC and very easy to figure out. The metro and bus system are all 1 euro no matter where you are going...metro to downtown takes about 25 minutes...you'll need to change at least one train...very simple; (6) the 53 bus stop is right outside the hotel and will take you downtown (about 25 minute ride)...very much worth it, if you don't want to take the metro; (7) plenty of restaurants & bars close to the hotel (authentic Spanish food, Chinese, Italian and many others); (8) several grocery/mini-marts close to the hotel, even an OPENCOR that is across the street from the hotel and is open 24 hours; (9) there are several banks on the walk from the hotel to the metro with ATM access; (10) Safe, safe, safe…the neighborhood is very safe any time of day…we would walk back from the metro at midnight to see Spaniard families sitting on park benches chatting away…never once did we feel threatened. CONS: (1) the hotel breakfast is 7 euros p/ person and is a bit skimpy…I paid for the whole 7 days up front, recommend you pay for your breakfast daily in case you want to try somewhere else; (2) the hotel offered internet, but it cost 6 euros an hour…they do give you a half hour of internet time free at check-in, but that goes by quick. Other than that, very good experience at this hotel…great neighborhood (barrio) and I would not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Better auality than UK Travelodges!”
Reviews.Author: BandMandM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Torrelaguna Travelodge for two nights at the end of May. With a little bit of research the hotel was easy enough to get to from the airport. I took the number 200 bus from Terminal 1 arrivals alighting at Agastia. From there it was a five minute walk to the hotel. The bus ride was a bargain at €1. On arriving at the hotel I was checked in pretty efficiently. I had booked a family room as I like the extra space and the bonus of the sofa however I was give a twin room instead. It was past 11pm and I couldn't be bother to complain about the mix up as the room was still very spacious. The room was exceptionally clean and all the fixtures and fittings were in exceleent coditition except for the walls. I don't know what it is about your typical Travelodge guest but whenever I stay in one the state of the room walls always bemuses me and Torrelaguna was no exception. The walls were dirty and had the paint scaped off them, this damage had obviously built up over a fairly long period of time so it was dissapointing that management had not seen fit to repaint. This is my only major complaint about the hotel. There were a couple of little niggles. The bed was a bit hard but it was a typical Spanish bed (thin mattress) and it didn't prevent me from getting a decent nights sleep. My booking confirmation said there was tea and coffee making facilities in the room, there was not so this was a bit dissapointing. The hotel is a bit out of the centre of the city but the bus stop that takes you directly to Sol is literally on the doorstep of the hotel. The number 53 takes about thirty minutes to get you in to the centre depending on traffic and a single ticket is only €1. The nearest metro station is Barrio de la Concepción on line 7. It's about a ten minute leisurely walk from the hotel. I got a three day tourist ticket for €13 this gives you unlimited travel on the metro, busses and local Renfe train services, you don't have to pay the 1€ suppliment to to the Airport if you get the tourist ticket. It was a real bargain and came in a lovely pouch with a metro/street map included. Breakfast is available at the hotel for €7.50 but I can't comment on it as I declined to eat at the hotel, they also had a seemingly reasonable bar menu for meals and snacks. There's a supermarket over the road which is open until 2am which is really handy for snacks and drinks. I'd definately stay at the Madrid Torrelaguna Travelodge again and for €38 for a two night stay it was an absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: horsepwr3
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is quite a distance from the city center, a bus stop is literally outside the front door of the hotel that transports you to the center of Madrid in about 25 minutes and costs one euro. (It was about an 11 euro taxi ride to get back late at night). The hotel itself is very basic but clean, with horrendously flat, hard pillows. My only real complaint is that there is really nothing nearby in terms of night life, should you decide to stay close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, functional”
Reviews.Author: johnj95
Reviews.Content: overall the experience was positive. pros: receptionists were good, had no issue whatsoever. rooms are kept clean and reasonably sized (not small for a single traveler) i had a very early flight, asked for a taxi reservation and it worked just fine. nearby "supermarket" where you can purchase your dinner/breakfast goods. bathroom is very conveniently sized, a nice gimmick is that after a hot shower a section of the mirror is untouched by the vapor, so you can go right in and shave, no need to wipe off condensation with a towel :) cons: not the best location, the metro is about 10 min away (although a bus stop is right in front of the hotel) wifi is not included, altough you can purchase time

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location”
Reviews.Author: Karachite
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 25th September. Hotel is around 12 to 15 minutes walk from Metro but bus stop is just oposite the hotel. Its quite nice and clean hotel. Tea and cofee making facilities were not in the room. Overall we enjoyed the stay. We will recommend this hotel. Buy the travel pass for your stay right from the airport and save money for transfers. I bought two day travel pass for Euro 8.80.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most convenient location, but is adequate in all areas.”
Reviews.Author: izzyblizzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while visiting Madrid. CHECK IN: Good customer service. Fairly good English, although we tried to speak Spanish as well. Between both our efforts, communication worked fine. Early check-in is available at 11 Euro, which is worth it if your flight gets in early. Be aware Internet access is also an extra charge. (4-6 Euro per day, depending on how many days you purchase.) LOCATION: About 30-40 minutes outside city center. We found the best way to get there from the airport was to take the #104 bus to Avenida de América (last stop on the bus, so can't miss it) and then catch the #122 bus (at the same location) which stops right outside the travelodge. (bus driver was very helpful in telling us what stop to get off). You can get the combo bus/metro pass at the airport. As far as getting downtown, the #53 bus will take you downtown from the hotel. (about 30-40 minutes). There is also a metro station (Barrio Le Concepcion) which is faster than the bus, but involves a longer walk (a bit over 1/2 mile), although there are several shops back to the hotel which we would stop to pick up some great ham, cheese, bread and wine and often make a dinner in our hotel rather than head back downtown in the evening. ROOM: Positives were good shower pressure, quiet, plenty of hot water, comfy bed with nice sheets, big towels, and extra pillows were gladly offered on request. The hotel and environs seemed quite safe. Negatives were it was a small room, basically clean, but showing a bit of wear. Plugs were hard to find for puter, cell phone, camera, etc. Ended up unplugging TV, etc, to have enough plugs for charging. FOOD The morning buffet (included in cost) was quite acceptable. Pretty American. Could get scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, peanut butter, yogurt, etc. In the evenings could get beer and some hard drinks. Restaurants in the immediate area are pretty scarce. Chin Chin (asian) next door was ok. There are also are some really good meat stores, markets, bakeries etc, as mentioned above between the metro stop and the hotel. Overall, its is not a bad place to stay and quite affordable. Although I think if I did Madrid again I would stay closer in.

Reviews.Title: “30 Euro for three nights-- what a deal!”
Reviews.Author: annaleiseandsiobhan
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Torrelaguna is actually not too bad if you want a good place to stay in Madrid for a few days. It's a little far out but good once you finally find the hotel. It took us a very long time to find it but it's actually maybe a seven minute walk from the station. From the airport take the Metro Aeropuerto T1 T2 T3 at Line 8. Transfer at Colombia at Line 9 then onto Avenida de America at Line 7 to Barrio de la Concepcion station. The easiest way to get to the hotel once you leave Barrio de la Concepcion Metro station is to keep straight on Calle de Martinez Villergas for about 250. At the traffic lights you will see a Santander bank across the street; once you cross, walk up about 50m to your left where you will be at Calle Torrelaguna. Continue to walk for another 70m up the hill. The hotel is at a junction on the opposite side of the street. Hotel was very clean, rooms spacious and comfortable with nice easy to sleep in twin beds. Nice large bathroom with shower and bath. This is a no frills hotel so don't expect too much in extras. There are a few shops in the area-we passed several small mercados on the way from the train station. The area is quiet and safe. The only downside is that there are not many restaurants to choose from so you will have to venture out a bit if you want to eat during the hours when a lot of businesses are closed. It would be nice too if the hotel had at least one English speaking channel besides EuroSport. Even CNN or BBC News would suffice but no one wants to watch EuroSport the whole time they are in their room. Having said that it's not too bad so I think I would stay at this hotel again if the great price of 30 Euro for three nights were available again.

Reviews.Title: “There Must be somewhere better”
Reviews.Author: Paddy54
Reviews.Content: The Good: 3 restaurants with 100m. Bus to CBD at door (40 mins) The Bad: Terribly noisy, At the junction of two main roads with traffic lights on the corner. If it's some sleep your looking for then "There Must be somewhere better."

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: andrewtscheer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights as part of a school tip to Spain. The hotel was very clean and modern. The rooms were small but I'm an American. Decor was very IKEA like faux wood and brushed chrome. The water pressure in the shower was unbelievable. Front desk staff was very nice English was good. He sells 5 euro phone cards that are 500 minutes to call the US that's the beat deal I saw. Being with a group tour of 50 we couldn't exactly pile onto a public bus. We took the metro everywhere. The walk was easy and not more that 10-15 minutes. I loved the metro system of Madrid. It really is extremely clean and you can get everywhere fast. nicer than NYC in my opinion... Breakfast was free and good. bread, pastry, eggs, cappuccinos, and more. It was really perfect. Internet was expensive it was like 3 euros for 15 minutes (wifi and the computer in the lobby). Overall I loved it. If you have and questions I'm actually much much better at answering those so feel free in messaging me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: ElWarpo
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in April in this hotel and it came up to spec in every way. Staff were very friendly and helped enormously. The bus into madrid town centre takes at least 30 minutes which is a bit of a pain in the [--]. It can get very crowded and hot. Hotel itself is very clean although after arriving back to the hotel for our first night stay we found 5 cockroaches (overturned) on our room floor. We were on the first floor and I don't have a clue how they got in. Must have been from the air conditioning. We asked for a another room and rthere was no bother at reception. We got another room on the second floor and we didn't have any experiences with cock roaches since that. We didn't have breakkie in the hotel and tried accross the road, Micheals restaurant.Be warned, they don't have much spanish and your allowed to smoke in there. Very nice people. We just pointed and smiled and got a very cheap but nice omelette (cold) and toast. All come to €8 for two people with tea and coffee. The next mornings we just bought stuff from open (supermarket beside Micheals restuarant) and eat that in the hotel lobby. The beds aren't great, I'm 6' 6" so that probably doesn't help but I found the beds to be rock hard. Maybe this is the way with all travel lodges. Apart from that it's a very clean hotel and the staff are brilliant and Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: AndynBex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and got it for a great price - about 40 euros per night. We were greeted by fairly friendly staff and the room was extremely clean, spacious and modern. The room had everything we needed and more. When we went out later that day, a really friendly lady was on the desk and gave us all of the information we needed to get around Madrid. The location isnt the best, we caught the number 53 bus from right outside the hotel into the city - puerta del sol and it took about 30 minutes, in good traffic. If you are planning on buying any groceries or goods to get you by, dont shop in the opencor directly opposite the hotel, when your in the city go to Carrefour at Goya (just before you get to puerta del sol). Opencor staff are rude and items are extremely over priced. The internet is quite over priced at 6 euros per hour, try and find an internet cafe in the city which will be about 1 euro per hour (we went to one directly in the centre of puerta del sol - when you come up from the metro get onto the path on your right and head straight up and you will see it on a second floor, saying internet - in lit up letters. Museo Del Jamon in Puerta del sol (loads of them dotted around the rest of the city) is a great place to get a ham and cheese crossiant, a jamon bocadillo, a cafe or a beer for only 1 euro each, as well as the Mcdonalds euro menu - cafe glacada (coffee & glace donut) - great for breakfast or mid morning or afternoon snack.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap cheerful hotel with fantastic public transport connections”
Reviews.Author: jeffm1971
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Madrid and booked this Travelodge as I am a regular user of travelodges in the UK. I must say that the UK based travelodeges need to brush up there act as this one in Madrid way exceeded my expectations as in cleanliness freindly attentive staff to public service, it was just brilliant. Getting to the hotel from the airport was also very easy. I took the metro from terminal 2 to "Campo de las naciones" which is 1 stop away and from there I took the 122 bus which drops you off right outside the hotel. Total journey time is 40 minutes approx. I purchased a 3 day tourist travel pass at 11 euros 60 cents and found it great value. There is usually a 1 euro airport supplement you have to pay but with the travel pass you dont have too. I cant wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations... loved madrid”
Reviews.Author: LoAmolItalia
Reviews.Content: From start to finish we thoroughly enjoyed our time at Travelodge and exploring the great city of Madrid. As well as grandparents, I was travelling with my husband and our two children aged under 10 and we felt the hotel was perfect for our needs. The room had everything needed without the frills. We requested a kettle, cups, tea,coffee, from reception, and this was no trouble whatsoever. The kids slept in a sofa bed and this was a good size and comfortable. The room was serviced every day, and all of the staff very helpful and friendly. For us, the advantages of this hotel were that despite being only a No53 bus ride away to the centre of Madrid (10-15mins), the location was out of the biz, so perfect for families when you want some peace and quiet to get the kids off to sleep, and for us to relax. The bus stop was literally outside the hotel door! We never tried breakfast in the hotel, but this was available, as well as a good supermarket (Opencor) just across the road, and there were a few restaurants nearby. Madrid itself has something for everyone - shopping, culture, restaurants, bars and has a very safe atmosphere. The locals were friendly and helful. We regularl used the metro and this was very good. As a family, we particulary enjoyed the cable car ride over the city which takes you to a nice viewpoint and park, the theme park, the zoo with its great dolphins, the Retiro park, which was huge, and the Palace, which has free entrance on a wednesday to all EU citizens (remember to take your passport with you). The Real Madrid football stadium was worth a visit too. One of the 'eating out' highlights for us was our meal at the 'Botin' restaurant which boasts of being the oldest restaurant in the world (Guinness Book of Records). The suckling pig was delicious, and they were very happy to see the children there too! Great service. Overall, if you are looking for a clean, quiet, budget hotel as a base to explore Madrid within reasonable distance then this will definitely not disappoint. Thoroughly enjoyed everything. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price..”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: Not much to say about Travelogdge's in general, as they are a basic, no-frills chain with pretty much similar layouts in each property - but this one could teach some of it's UK based siblings a thing or two. Rooms were clean, comfortable and well enough equipped for a budget hotel. Bathroom was immaculate and shower powerful. Laminate wood floors and a comfortable desk chair gave the room a spartan yet contemporary look. Locationwise, it was perfect for me - less that 30 minutes bus journey from Madrid Airport (200/204 to Avenida de America and bus 122 to the hotel door!). A grocery store is in operation across the road, which can provide basic snacks/drinks etc at a reasonable price. Check-in was a little on the slow side, but that's about the only real niggle I could find. For €45 this was exactly what I needed at the price I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jcctravelbugs
Reviews.Content: A great value hotel, a bit out of the way but with Madrid's transport link it is easy to get anywhere. A tip for anybody with luggage they are happy to pull/carry through 2 streets (approx 1/2 mile). Rather than pay out & risk being ripped off by taxi, it is possible to get from the airport to travelodge in 15 -20 minutes by bus for 1 euro. As you leave the airport the taxi rank is on the left & the bus stop for the No 22 bus is on the right. This bus terminates at the bus station mentioned by others. If you are willing to walk the streets with your luggage you can save a few quid. The hotel is comfortable with nice, polite, helpful staff. Any information you need about getting around Madrid can be got from reception. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room but many places close by to get breakfast. The area around the hotel is clean & safe as is the city centre at anytime day or night. We were advised that pickpockets were a problem but we never felt at risk or targeted as tourists. The bus to the city centre leaves from right outside the hotel, I think it was No 52. Buses can be caught back from city centre long after midnight & are still 1 euro. For all football fans the bernabeau stadium tour is a must ( we were lucky enough to get to a match). to get to the stadium is simple either by metro or bus No 24 from city centre. We will definitely be back to Madrid in the near future & the travelodge will be our base without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Culter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and found the hotel to be quiet, clean and the staff who spoke English helpful. The bus to the centre of Madrid stops outside the hotel and this is very convenient but the journey can take up to 45mins to the centre. We took breakfast at the VIPS restaurant across the road and it was very good value as were the evening meals. The staff here are helpful but don't speak English so a few basic words of Spanish are useful. As regards the trip from the airport by Taxi - we too were ripped off by a taxi driver who added a 10 euro airport supplement to the fare on the meter and he seemed not to know his way to the hotel. However the trip from the hotel to the airport from the taxi rank outside the hotel was fine with only a 5 euro supplement and a direct route.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Olivia88
Reviews.Content: Good value stay - fairly standard travelodge fare, room a little bit shabby but perfectly ok as a base. Easy to get to central Madrid by bus and the nearest Metro stop is a not too taxing 10 minute walk away. If you are getting the bus into town, the final stop on the route is also the first stop on the return route. Took us ages to work that out! Handy local shops, including a supermarket with bakery counter.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive parking and not always available.”
Reviews.Author: cutchi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for 70 euros total. I chose this for parking but it was very expensive at 18 euros per day. Be warned, when we arrived on Saturday the car park was empty but on Monday it was full as it is not reserved solely for hotel guests and seemed to be used by local businessmen during the week. Great not to have to drive in Madrid traffic tho', and the 53 bus at 1 euro right outside is a great way to get into the centre - terminates at Puerta del sol. We had breakfasts at the Museo del Jamon cafe in the Plaza Mayor - for 2 huge cheese and ham croissants, a coffee and a small beer the bill was 4 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: elsie_hughes1
Reviews.Content: This travelodge is very reasonable ( we got it for 45 euros a night ). Everywhere was clean and basic - if you want frills then you pay for them. All we wanted was somewhere clean to sleep as we were out all day. There are a few eating places in the vicinity which is handy if you don't want to go back into the city to eat in the evenings. Taxis from the airport are very expensive. We caught a 200 bus from terminal 1, asked the driver to drop us off at AGASTIA and walked the rest ( less than 5 mins) and it cost us only 1 euro each ! When you get off at Agastia, cross the blue bridge, carry on walking down the road ( past a garage ) until you get to a fountain, turn right ( immediate right - not diagonal ) carry on down that road until you see a chinese restaurant Chin Chin and the Travelodge is next door. Got these instructions by e mail from the travelodge. Staff here very friendly and helpful. Bus 53 stops directly outside and takes you right into Madrid. Would have no hesitation in going back here for a cheap but clean accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Scousetwirly
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, not in the centre but well connected by bus no. 53 to the centre and buses 200 - 204 to the airport. Metro connections are not so convenient and taxis could work out expensive for the non-business traveller. The staff are helpful. The en suite bathrooms are good. Food is readily available in the near vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel-great local transport”
Reviews.Author: GRANNYMC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel very clean and staff more than helpful.If needed, just request complimentary hairdrier and tea/coffee facilities from reception. Transport from airport couldn't have been easier: take the bus 200 from outside the terminal buildings to the main Americas station. Then take bus 122,outside the station,on the main street, which drops you off at the door of the hotel. Each bus costs 1 euro! When travelling into centre of Madrid, take bus 53 from straight outside the hotel door again, this also costs 1 euro and takes about 10 mins ,depending on traffic. Chin Chin restaurant is beside the hotel and does Asian and Chineese food-food great and very reasonable. Hope this review helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Antony
Reviews.Content: We paid 39 euros per night which represented excellent value for money. The hotel is quite new and as you would expect clean and tidy. Rooms are typical travelodge sytle, basic but comfortable. Over the road is a supermarket and a few restaurants, plus a few cafe bars which are quite cheap for drinks and snacks. I would recommend this hotel as its in a safe area, although the area around the nearest tube ( Barrio de la concepcion ) is a little run down. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to the tube station and taxis are available if you dont fancy the walk back late at night. You can i think get a bus from outside the hotel to the centre if you prefer! Dont stop here if you want the hustle and bustle of central Madrid. If you are on a budget and dont mind the 10 minute walk and 10/15 minute tube, its a really good base for a few days. Ladies, make sure you bring a hairdryer as reception ran out and my missis wasnt too impressed!! The great thing about Madrid is you can get a tube direct from Barajas Airport right into the centre, dont waste time getting shuttle buses, the tube system is brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a major city”
Reviews.Author: Rothwell8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the UK August Bank Holiday and managed to get a great deal on the room, with a rate of just EUR39 per night. The hotel is not in the heart of Madrid City, which might be off putting to some, but it is within very easy reach of the city that is made accessible by good public transport links. As noted in other reviews the number 53 bus stops right outside the hotel and only costs EUR1 each way for a ride into the city. Taking the bus also means that you get to see other areas of the city that normally you would overlook if staying in the heart of the city. The Travelodge is placed in a suburban area a couple of miles outside the city centre. There is a small plaza opposite the hotel with an 'open all hours' convenience store selling most essentials (not particularly cheap), and a couple of restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and the rooms very clean and to the same standard in the UK, if not better, although no additional facilities in the room, i.e kettle (other then aircon). We made other arrangements for breakfast so cannot comment on this. Tea and coffee could be purchased from the small area throughout the day. The hotel felt very secure and safe. Despite its location I would recommend this hotel, especially if you manage to get a good deal on rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: seasoned_daveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel can hardly be faulted on any account. The breakfast times were very flexible and the staff friendly and helpful with inquiries. There is a 10-15min walk to the metro and placed within the Madrid ayuntamiento its fairy good value as well as being close to a few amenities like an Asian (far eastern) restaurant and an Opencor (convenience store).

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: thumper1
Reviews.Content: We got a really good rate by booking well in advance of our visit. The hotel was clean and safe. It was close to the hospital, so there were businesses and restaurants in the area. We ate at Chin-Chin and liked the Asian fusion cuisine and the reasonable prices. Bus 53 stops right in front of the hotel. The metro is about a 10 min walk, but the hill makes it difficult with luggage. Buy a bus & metro pass which can be used for either -- as well as getting to the airport on line 8 metro. It costs 7 euros for 10 trips.

Reviews.Title: “MY FIRST TRIP TO MADRID”
Reviews.Author: MADRID2008
Reviews.Content: AIRPORT TO TRAVELODGE Arrived on 19/05/08. Barajas Airport. Taxi to Travelodge. Cab drive said €30. I said we use meter. He agreed. When we arrived the meter read €10.50 + sevice charges (servicio) €5.50 = Total €16. The Cab driver started misbehaving asking for €25. I paid him as I was too tired to argue. On Return journey to the Airport by Taxi. I made sure the Taxi man charged just the meter. So I paid € 16.90. The Taxi stand is just to the right of hotel's exit. THE TRAVELODGE Very Clean. Beds & lenin very clean. No smell. No noise. Tv channels in spanish except CNN & Eurosports. Staff Very friendly. They speak English. Will give u a map of the city. Breakfast @ travelodge €7.50 adult €3.75 child not great. So we got Danishes, Cakes etc from the Supermarket opposite the hotel.Very Tasty. There is NO tea making stuff in the room. No Ironing facility. TRAVELODGE TO MADRID CITY 2 WAYS- Bus & Metro. Either cost €1 / trip "anywhere" in Madrid. (Also for a child) Buy pack of 10 tickets, It will cost €6.70 (bus & metro). Bus 53 stops right in front of the travelodge. Takes 20-25min to "SOL". The Metro station is 6min walk . "Barrio de Conceptiono". AROUND MADRID CITY We got hop on hop off Madrid vision bus. for 2 days travel. Cost €18.50 on the Internet. €20.50 on the bus. Under 6yr free. AROUND TRAVELODGE Small supermarket just oppostie (OpenCor) open till 2am. Has all essential stuff needed. Has a bakery too. Chinese restaurant x2, Pizzia place (Mamamia), VIPS, Micheal's restaurant. All just across the road. A "Mosque" is 6min walk away. Has a restaurant in its basement - Opens around Salat time only. Pure Arabic dishes. I did not try. Halal Greocery shop to the right of the Mosque. MUST SEE PLACES Do go to VENTAS - Bull fighting Ring. Its near the hotel. 5mins by bus. Daily Bull fighting show starts at 7pm. Excellent atmosphere. The zoo is in Casa de campo. Ticket is €20 adult, €10 child. Use discount vouches u get on madrid vision bus €3. Great Dolphin & Sea Lion shows. EATING Halal food availabe @ NEMRUT (turkish) - available at several places in the city. The chef claimed it was Halal. So, we went for it.. Desi - food, Southeast Asian - in low supply. Some shops at Lavapies Metro - apperently the Southall of madrid. But not too impressive - best to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ruckandmaul
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous remarks by caseypaul. Everthing was fine and very clean. It did the job at a good price. Breakfast was basic and internet v.expensive. The hotel is in a nice area, next to some good looking restaurants. Could of done with a loo brush though!?

Reviews.Title: “Too basic”
Reviews.Author: caseypaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business as part of a group from 20 - 24 April 2008. Accommodation was booked by our host so we had no choice in the matter. Travelodges are generally fine if all you need is a clean bed for the night and a quick bite to eat in the morning. This Travelodge is no exception. Staff were helpful and generally quite friendly. As a hotel for Madrid sightseeing, I would not recommend this hotel. Although it is only a +/- 25 minute bus ride from the centre, you can find much cheaper, better and more characterful hostales (small hotels) right in the centre so why stay all the way out in Torrelaguna? Ate breakfast at the hotel on day 1 only. Selection was poor and quality likewise. Dreadful coffee. There's a cafe/bar across the street (beside the OpenCor mini-market) which is much better and cheaper too! As you might expect, facilities for business customers are next to non-existent. The bar (which seems to be always closed) is just an extension of the breakfast area and not conducive to chat and relaxation. Internet access is available but charged at a whopping €12/hour. Rooms are very clean but spartan. Bathrooms equally so. Shampoo, gel and soap are very, very low-end and are not replenished for the length of your stay - bring your own!! If your business takes you to this part of Madrid, I cannot recommend the Travelodge Torrelaguna for the reasons stated. If you are planning a leisure trip, stay in the centre and soak up the wonderful noche de Madrid!!! Sorry Travelodge but this hotel should be on the side of a motorway not in leafy suburban Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Leigh_Whitworth
Reviews.Content: Very good. I stayed here for four nights. Friendly English speaking staff. Good breakfast for 7.5 Euros. Bus outside and Metro within 20 minute walk. Would definately stay here again. Even had a bath which I like in a hotel room. Get the 122 bus to the end of the line at Campo de las Naciones and you are one stop from Terminals 1, 2 and 3 and three stops from Terminal 4 on Line 8 ( Pink one ). Even I managed it and I have no sense of direction!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,cheap and good young people service.confy beds”
Reviews.Author: mariloBarcelona
Reviews.Content: For 1 euro you get to the center with the bus they have in front of the main door. Very good people and friendly with english speakers.Clean and cheap.For what I did pay I went to a very good restaurant in the center.I will definetly come back, lovely city and amaizing hotel service in Spain

Reviews.Title: “a total NO”
Reviews.Author: mepossem
Reviews.Content: never go even near to this place. terrible serivce, after a day they couldn t even find the official claims forms, had to call (really!) police. hair on the floor, no way to deal with people. [--] hotel i have ever been in in madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Olveragirl
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid in June 2007 to see Mana in concert. It was the first time I had ever been to Madrid and we were a bit scared about the trip in a way. When we got to Madrid airport and asked taxi driver for the Travelodge Torrelaguna he seemed to get really mad ranting in Spanish because he didn't know where it was ( I don't think it's been there long but it's near the Novotel) however he managed to find it ok and it was only 15 minutes drive from the airport. When we walked in it was great, we have stayed at many Travelodges in England but none have been this luxurious! The front desk were very helpfull and our room was lovely and clean with air con. You could walk from the hotel to Madrid centre but it would take about 45 mins. There is really no need as the number 52 bus comes past the front of the hotel every few minutes. The bus services in Madrid are fantastic. Only 1 euro wherever you go and they are so realiable, buses are clean and air conditioned. Only problem is they are very popular and can get very full. This hotel is situated on the outskirts of Madrid but is near to many small restaurants dotted around so look out for them. We ate in the Italian across the rd a few times because it was lovely. There is also a supermarket just across the road which is really useful. Only problem I could come up with in the hotel is that the maids were very noisy in the morning. From 6:30am they were continuously banging doors. It wouldn't stop me returning though.

Reviews.Title: “Can`t say, because we had problems with the reservation”
Reviews.Author: RCaros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Madrid with three friends. We booked Travelodge Torrelaguna at Travelodge.com website. It was everything ok. We received an e-mail confirming our stay. We always make reservations using the hotels website and pay with credit card and we never have a problem. We arrived at Madri 1a.m., the night before the Gay Parade. We were exausted because we drove for 600 km from Lisbon (Portugal) to Madrid. The Travelodge looked ok and in a very good location. The bad news was that our reservation was canceled because they said we informed the wrong credit card number. We told that it was impossible. It was not the first time that we made a reservation using the Internet and we knew that we must use a valid credit card to garantee it. The front desk guy showed us the credit card number (was a stupid number like 4500000 something...), but we were sure that we didn`t inform that number. We told the guy that it was a stupid thing. We never inform a wrong number and we were sure to arrive that day. The hotel was full. We talked to the guy. While we were there, one guy that made the reservation by phone enter. And other two guys waited some minutes till the reception guy find their reservation. (Good luck, he found!). He tried to find other hotel after we asked. But my husband called another hotel and finally we had a place to stay the two nights. I want to say that if a client appears in the middle of the night with a reservation you just can`t say that he was wrong and "the problem is yours". It´s not a polite thing to say. I still don`t know what happened, but i`m sure that i put the correct number. I`ll never try to make another reservation at Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dm99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room at the Travelodge in Torrelaguna for 4 nights. We got a great deal at 45 Euros a night. Finding the hotel was probably the most difficult part of our stay, fortunately my partner speaks spanish so he could ask the locals, but for non-spanish speakers I would highly recommend printing out a map of the area if you are trying to find your way from the train station. It is not that hard, it is just that the central Madrid maps don't cover this area in detail. The walk from the Torrelaguna station is 10-15 minutes (depending if you are dragging suitcases with you). Once you are settled at the hotel, the easiest way to get into central Madrid is on the bus that leaves from the front door of the hotel. It is very cheap (around 60 Euro cents), and you get to see a lot on the way. Ask the staff at reception for a map and information on the bus. We found the room to be a typical travelodge style, and very new. The room is basic, but very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located in a residential area, with a lot of high rise apartments surrounding it. There is a 7-11 style supermarket across the road, and 3 restaurants that provide reasonable family meals. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but bought croissants from the small supermarket across the road. The staff on reception desk were very helpful. The only issue we had was that they called at 10am to ask if we wanted our room made up - when we had left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Would recommend this hotel to travellers on a budget, who like new, clean, private accommodation rather than hostels etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holyrood99
Reviews.Content: I found this to be an excellent value hotel in a safe and pleasant area of the city. The hotel is exactly as you would expect of a Travelodge. Its modern, clean and the staff were extremely helpful indeed. They supplied excellent maps of Madrid and informed us of all the options for transport. There is a but stop directly in front of the hotel entrance, it takes about 20-30 minutes to get Puerta del Sol in the heart of Madrid, and the frequency of the service meant that we didn’t have to wait more than a few minutes for a bus to appear. It only cost 1 euro per journey and it was a very pleasant way to get into the city centre. There are a few restaurants within close proximity of the hotel and although they may not be the kind of places that many tourists may look for, they were full of authentic Spanish families enjoying their night out. There’s also a modern, well stocked, Carrefour, convenience store just over the road from the hotel. It was a very good place to stock up on supplies for a trip into the city but not at city centre prices. I stayed there for three nights and heard no noise from either other residents or the street. Getting to the airport was also very easy. It took about ten minutes in a taxi we caught at the rank adjacent to the hotel and cost around ten euros. There’s also a bus stop for the airport situated about five or ten minutes walk away. For anyone on a budget or travelling with someone who doesn’t want to stay in the madhouse that the city centre can be I would thoroughly recommend it. Their nightly rate is 35 euros per room, and at that price I doubt it will be beaten for value. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mkrovers
Reviews.Content: Situated a short ten minute taxi ride from barrajas airport, the hotel is situated in the business district, which to be honest was an advantage to be able to escape the noise of the the city centre. we stayed for a four night break over the half term with the kids. the room was far more spacious than you would get in the uk, with the sofa bed and rollaway bed in use there was still plenty of room. the hotel is immaculately clean and the staff are very friendly and helpfull . the journey into the city centre is easy with a frequent bus service from the front door and at 1 euro each way its a bargain!. excellent accommodation at an excellent price

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ragan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: It was a little far from the airport considering it was only a stop over for us to stay one night but it was quite satisfying. There is a GREAT restaurant close by which we highly recommend! The room is unbelievable comfortable as is the bathroom. Not very convenient though if you are wanting to head into town.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel situated in the Torrelaguna area of Madrid. The location of the hotel is ideal if you do not want to stay in the center of Madrid and want to escape the traffic mayhem! Beware though, as I discovered many taxi drivers do not know the hotel as it is less than 6 months old. If you want to get into the centre of Madrid, then the bus stop outside the hotel allows access to the cetnre. The hotel itself is very modern and is impressive the minute you walk in. A stylish bar/cafe and seating area where breakfast and lunch is served. The Hotel staff are one of the best in customer service. As we didn't know much Spanish and didnt know the area well, we asked for a lot of advice on where to visit! They were very helpful and friendly and gave us very good tips! We had two rooms booked. One Triple Room (Double & Sofa Bed) and One Double. Both rooms were clean and welcoming the minute we walked in. The bathroom was very spacious in both rooms. Overall, We enjoyed our stay in Madrid and a big factor of this was because of Travelodge Torrelaguna! Definately Recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Torrelaguna Madrid
